description: Describes the general type of media that DOI Metadata refers to.

enum.name: Audiovisual
enum.description: A series of visual representations imparting an impression of motion when shown in succession. May or may not include sound.

enum.name: Collection
enum.description: An aggregation of resources, which may encompass collections of one resourceType as well as those of mixed types. A collection is described as a group; its parts may also be separately described.

enum.name: DataPaper
enum.description: A factual and objective publication with a focused intent to identify and describe specific data, sets of data, or data collections to facilitate discoverability.

enum.name: Dataset
enum.description: Data encoded in a defined structure.

enum.name: Image
enum.description: A visual representation other than text.

enum.name: InteractiveResource
enum.description: A resource requiring interaction from the user to be understood, executed, or experienced.

enum.name: Model
enum.description: An abstract, conceptual, graphical, mathematical or visualization model that represents empirical objects,  phenomena, or physical processes.

enum.name: PhysicalObject
enum.description: An inanimate, three-dimensional object or substance.

enum.name: Service
enum.description: An organized system of apparatus, appliances, staff, etc., for supplying some function(s) required by end users.

enum.name: Software
enum.description: A computer program in source code (text) or compiled form. Use this type for all software components supporting scholarly research.

enum.name: Sound
enum.description: A resource primarily intended to be heard.

enum.name: Text
enum.description: A resource consisting primarily of words for reading.

enum.name: Workflow
enum.description: A structured series of steps which can be executed to produce a final outcome, allowing users a means to specify and enact their work in a more reproducible manner.

enum.name: Other
enum.description: If selected, supply a value for ResourceType.
